00005 #include <stdio.h>
00006 #include <stdlib.h>
00007 #include <string.h>
00008 #include <errno.h>
00009 #include <fcntl.h>
00010 #include <unistd.h>
00011 #include <pwd.h>
00012 #include <net/if.h>
00013 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00014 #include <linux/if_tun.h>
00015 
00016 static void Usage(char *name)
00017 {
00018   fprintf(stderr, "Create: %s [-b] [-u owner] [-t device-name] "
00019     "[-f tun-clone-device]\n", name);
00020   fprintf(stderr, "Delete: %s -d device-name [-f tun-clone-device]\n\n", 
00021     name);
00022   fprintf(stderr, "The default tun clone device is /dev/net/tun - some systems"
00023     " use\n/dev/misc/net/tun instead\n\n");
00024   fprintf(stderr, "-b will result in brief output (just the device name)\n");
00025   exit(1);
00026 }
00027 
00028 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00029 {
00030   struct ifreq ifr;
00031   struct passwd *pw;
00032   long owner = geteuid();
00033   int tap_fd, opt, delete = 0, brief = 0;
00034   char *tun = "", *file = "/dev/net/tun", *name = argv[0], *end;
00035 
00036   while((opt = getopt(argc, argv, "bd:f:t:u:")) > 0){
00037     switch(opt) {
00038       case 'b':
00039         brief = 1;
00040         break;
00041       case 'd':
00042         delete = 1;
00043   tun = optarg;
00044         break;
00045       case 'f':
00046   file = optarg;
00047   break;
00048       case 'u':
00049   pw = getpwnam(optarg);
00050   if(pw != NULL){
00051     owner = pw->pw_uid;
00052     break;
00053   }
00054         owner = strtol(optarg, &end, 0);
00055   if(*end != '\0'){
00056     fprintf(stderr, "'%s' is neither a username nor a numeric uid.\n",
00057       optarg);
00058     Usage(name);
00059   }
00060         break;
00061       case 't':
00062         tun = optarg;
00063         break;
00064       case 'h':
00065       default:
00066         Usage(name);
00067     }
00068   }
00069 
00070   argv += optind;
00071   argc -= optind;
00072 
00073   if(argc > 0)
00074     Usage(name);
00075 
00076   if((tap_fd = open(file, O_RDWR)) < 0){
00077     fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open '%s' : ", file);
00078     perror("");
00079     exit(1);
00080   }
00081 
00082   memset(&ifr, 0, sizeof(ifr));
00083 
00084   ifr.ifr_flags = IFF_TAP | IFF_NO_PI;
00085   strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, tun, sizeof(ifr.ifr_name) - 1);
00086   if(ioctl(tap_fd, TUNSETIFF, (void *) &ifr) < 0){
00087     perror("TUNSETIFF");
00088     exit(1);
00089   }
00090 
00091   if(delete){
00092     if(ioctl(tap_fd, TUNSETPERSIST, 0) < 0){
00093       perror("TUNSETPERSIST");
00094       exit(1);
00095     }    
00096     printf("Set '%s' nonpersistent\n", ifr.ifr_name);
00097   }
00098   else {
00099     if(ioctl(tap_fd, TUNSETPERSIST, 1) < 0){
00100       perror("TUNSETPERSIST");
00101       exit(1);
00102     }
00103     if(ioctl(tap_fd, TUNSETOWNER, owner) < 0){
00104       perror("TUNSETPERSIST");
00105       exit(1);
00106     } 
00107     if(brief)
00108       printf("%s\n", ifr.ifr_name);
00109     else printf("Set '%s' persistent and owned by uid %ld\n", ifr.ifr_name, 
00110     owner);
00111   }
00112   return(0);
00113 }
